item.title: Hope, despair as many still missing
item.description: Suri: Sunny Shah lies on a shabby bed at the Suri Municipal Hospital, his legs fractured and groaning in pain. But the 21-year-old clings on to hope: someone told him his mother Renu, 48, and three other relatives who were travelling with him in the general compartment of the Vananchal Express are missing.

item.title: ‘Sabotage possible, driver’s action unusual’
item.description: Kolkata: Railway Board Chairman Vivek Sahay on Monday did not rule out the possibility of “sabotage” leading to the train crash, saying it was an “unusual collision that took place at Sainthia”.

item.title: The day after, some baffling questions
item.description: A day after 63 people were killed and 150 injured in an early morning collision between the Uttarbanga Express and Vananchal Express on Monday, some questions have baffled railway officials and the public. Here are some of them:

item.title: Anti-collision devices caught in red tape
item.description: New Delhi: In the 14 months during which Mamata Banerjee has been at the helm of the Railways Ministry, as many as 428 people have been killed and over 600 injured in some 200 train accidents. But the collision between the Uttarbanga Express and Vananchal Express on Monday may have been averted had a system like the Anti-Collision Device (ACD) been installed on the Bardhaman-Rampurhat section of the Howrah division.

item.title: Yuvraj Singh under I-T scanner for IPL earnings
item.description: Chandigarh: The central excise department, Chandigarh region, will soon issue notices to four cricket players, including Yuvraj Singh, for payment of Rs 1.17 crore as service tax on the income from the first and the second IPL seasons.

item.title: Mining row: Reddy turns the table on Cong
item.description: Bangalore: Under attack over alleged illegal mining, Karnataka Tourism Minister G Janardhana Reddy on Monday said he and his brother Revenue Minister G Karunakara Reddy would resign from the ministry if there is a "shred" of evidence against them.

item.title: Babhli barrage standoff: Naidu says no to bail
item.description: Hyderabad: TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu and party leaders arrested by Maharashtra Police stuck to their stand and refused to accept bail after a fresh hearing was conducted upon completion of their two-day judicial remand period today.

item.title: HC restores MCOCA against Sadhvi, others
item.description: Mumbai: The Bombay High Court on Monday ordered that Sadhvi Pragya Thakur and other 10 accused in the 2008 Malegaon bomb blasts case will face trial under Maharashtra's tough MCOCA, a year after charges on them under this anti -terror law were dropped.

item.title: Bengal rail accident due to human error?
item.description: Sainthia: Is human error responsible for the horrific rail accident that took place in the early hours of Monday morning in West Bengal's Birbhum district that left over 60 dead and nearly 157 injured.

item.title: Omar Abdullah likely to reshuffle cabinet
item.description: Srinagar: Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah is planning a cabinet reshuffle aimed at strengthening his government and may also drop some tainted ministers from the cabinet, sources in Srinagar said on Monday.

item.title: Curfew lifted from Sopore, Valley still disturbed
item.description: Srinagar: Authorities on Monday lifted curfew from Sopore town and restriction on movement of people across Kashmir Valley but life continued to remain disrupted due to a week-long shutdown called by the separatists.

item.title: HC rejects Sajjan Kumar's plea to quash charges
item.description: New Delhi: In a setback to senior Congress leader Sajjan Kumar, the Delhi High Court today refused to quash various charges including that of murder against him in a 1984 anti-Sikh riots case, saying the delay in prosecution has apparently benefited him.

item.title: Delhi Police, MCD top list of most corrupt depts
item.description: New Delhi: The two departments which have the maximum interface with the public, are also the most corrupt, according to the number of corruption cases filed by Delhi's Anti Corruption Branch (ACB) in the last three years.

item.title: Mamata didi, when will you learn to take responsibility?
item.description: Union Railway Minister Mamata Banerjee may have been too young to have reacted or to have been inspired by Lal Bahadur Shastri, her predecessor at Rail Bhavan many years ago. When Shastri resigned in 1956 following a train accident that killed around 150 passengers near Ariyalur in Tamil Nadu, Mamata was just a few months old. But the lesson still lasts and Mamata could do well by brushing up with India’s political history.

item.title: Court accepts Ahmadi's resignation from Bhopal trust
item.description: New Delhi: The Supreme Court Monday accepted the resignation of former chief justice A.M. Ahmadi as chairman of the Bhopal Memorial Hospital Trust.

item.title: Being Muslim in a climate of paranoia
item.description: Messing up your grammar to ensure your safety, or rather the safety of your fellow air-bound passengers (or “guests”, as air carriers like to call them these days) — that’s a step I reflexively took on a recent Bangalore-Delhi flight.

item.title: The stinking rich ex-ADC
item.description: Chandigarh: From a penthouse to one kanal plot; a plush bungalow to flats in posh localities of Gurgaon and Delhi; Nirvikar Singh, the tainted Aide-de-Camp (ADC) of former Punjab Governor-cum-Chandigarh Administrator General (retd) S F Rodrigues, has amassed a lot of wealth in his and his family’s name in a span of just two years. These two years were the last of his tenure as ADC in Chandigarh.

item.title: Naidu eyes bypolls from jail
item.description: Hyderabad: It is with an eye on by-elections to 12 Assembly constituencies in Telangana that the Telugu Desam Party (TDP) has raked up the issue of Babli irrigation project that is coming up in Nanded district in neighbouring Maharashtra. TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu who did a U-turn on Telangana separate state demand and batted for a unified Andhra, has raised the issue to send a message in Telangana that he still sympathises with the people.

item.title: NZ, Oz new destinations for NRI marriage fraud
item.description: New Delhi: New Zealand and Australia are fast becoming new hot spots for rising cases of fraudulent marriages by Non-Resident Indians for receiving large dowry, if one goes by government assessment

item.title: Separatist shutdown, restrictions cripple Srinagar again
item.description: Srinagar: A shutdown called by separatists and restrictions imposed by authorities paralysed life in Srinagar on Sunday, just a day after a semblance of normalcy was restored after days of strikes and curfew.
